column5: hello wondering if anyone knows what is a good salmon and steelhead casting rod for floating and throwing lures that is at a descent price. I am just getting in to baitcasters and what not just looking for some good recommendations  thanks
Check this thread out  http://ontariofishingcommunity.com/forums/index.php?showtopic=69050&hl=%2Bsteelhead+%2Brod  I ended up buying a SHimano Convergence for around $98 at CT. I like it!
I've been using Streamside rods for the last quite a few years...  Guaranteed for life and i believe there not much more then $100...  Available at Angling Outfitters in Woodstock...

I have a st. Croix wild river 9'6" casting for bottom bouncing and throwing hardware and a quantum cold water 10'6" for floating.  The st. Croix is too fast for floating but they may have other models that are a more moderate action to suit both. I'd also choose an avid over the wild river if you can find one in sale.
Ok would you say 210 for the avid 10'6" is a good price
That's pretty good. What reel are you planning on using with it?
